snippet: The proposed new drug would combine Merck’s drug Zetia, which lowers “bad” cholesterol, with the generic version of Lipitor, the statin made by Pfizer.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration rejects an application by Merck to combine its cholesterol-fighting drug Zetia with the generic version of Lipitor, the statin made by Pfizer; agency asks for additional data that could lead it to reconsider the drug combination.
lead_paragraph: The proposed new drug would combine Merck’s drug Zetia, which lowers “bad” cholesterol, with the generic version of Lipitor, the statin made by Pfizer.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Rejects Merck’s Application for Combination Drug
headline.main: In Rejection, F.D.A. Wants More Data From Merck
headline.print_headline: In Rejection, F.D.A Wants More Data From Merck
